content: Anyone else think its hard to figure out whether you have clicked or not in a reaction when dark mode is enabled?
It seems totally plausible we don't have the right styling for that. Open an issue with screenshots?
Created #10840

light
dark

So i'm not sure if it's because i'm a long time dark mode user or something, but using reactions on czo, I can tell I reacted with :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes: on darkmode, but I can't tell that I reacted with :tada: on light mode
@Vishnu Ks do you still think this is the case looking at my screenshots?

@Cynthia Lin I was actually thinking more about the case where there is only one reaction. In the pic you sent one has been reacted by the user and the other was not reacted. So I can easily tell the diffrence in color. Its harder for me when there is only one reaction and no point of comparison.
This one for example Screenshot-from-2018-11-18-01-29-22.png
Its hard for me to tell by just looking at the heart emoji that whether I have reacted to it or not.

dark
light

I think it's pretty clear on dark mode to tell if I've reacted or not for me; I think what might be influencing it is the add reactions button to the right with the same background as the reacted emoji?
On the contrary I can barely differentiate between if I reacted on light mode or not; again, not sure if it's because I've been using dark mode for so long :)

Did you built the dark mode for reacted reactions? Actually I built the feature to distinguish reactions that has been reacted by the logged in user in normal mode. Maybe thats the reason I can easily spot the diffrence in normal mode :)
If its not clear to you that the blue is reacted one we should think about making it better as well.
I've worked on dark mode a bit, but I don't know if I've specifically made changes to the emoji picker coloring itself

I think the case with this is if you use light mode regularly and you suddenly switch to dark mode, things like coloring are going to be hard to notice since you're new to it because you don't know the "default" coloring
Looking at screenshot, I think the issue is genuine. Can I work on this issue? I have cloned Zulip using Vagrant, and looking forward to contributing here.
Same for dark mode to light mode :) so this is probably more of an UX issue if anything
Yeah. Anyway there is room for improvement I guess :)
@Prateek Jain Sure!

Prateek, how do you propose to resolve the issue? I think the main issue is, like Vishnu said, unless you have reactions side by side, new users to a mode won't be able to tell what's the "default" coloring or "selected" coloring. So things like making the reacted coloring darker aren't going to resolve the issue
we can change the colour to something else which would be pretty different from the background.
Maybe something lighter?
What shade of color do you have in mind?
I think a lighter shade of grey would go with the UI.
I think the best solution would probably to not have a colored background when you haven't reacted (but keep the outline), and add the darker blue/black color after you react
or maybe translucent blue
Ya, that could work as well.
@Vishnu Ks any feedback on which of the proposed solutions would be the best to try out?

I think the best solution would probably to not have a colored background when you haven't reacted (but keep the outline), and add the darker blue/black color after you react

This should be good enough I think.
Sounds good! @Prateek Jain feel free to post screenshots as you work and open the PR whenever you're ready, good luck :)

So i'm not sure if it's because i'm a long time dark mode user or something, but using reactions on czo, I can tell I reacted with :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes: on darkmode, but I can't tell that I reacted with :tada: on light mode

FWIW, looking at those screenshots I have the opposite reaction! The contrast in dark mode is very subtle, and I don't see it unless I'm looking very closely.

I've always used light mode, so that may not be a coincidence :slight_smile: The contrast in light mode is kind of subtle too, but I easily see it.

On the old laptop screen I'm using right now, it's basically impossible to tell the two cases apart in night mode. I think we should just use a blue tinge, like we do in light mode, to distinguish the case that you've reacted.
@Prateek Jain FYI
IMG-20181120-WA0004-01.jpeg
@Vishnu Ks @Tim Abbott Will this work? I have added a different colour border.
@Prateek Jain Lets do the blue color like we do in normal mode. The coloring of border makes it look odd.
Yeah, agreed, blue color is best.
IMG-20181121-WA0000-01.jpeg
@Vishnu Ks @Tim Abbott Now? I have added the exact same specs as that of light mode.
@Prateek Jain Can you post a better resolution photo?
my guess is we don't want it so light. I.e. maybe that tinge with some opacity
245568-01.jpeg
I also think it looks very light in case we use the same colours as in light mode, some opacity would be nice.
@Vishnu Ks Your views on this?
245664-01.jpeg
This looks good, without excessive lightness which looked odd in the previous screenshot.
As a common dark mode user, that shade of gray looks pretty out-of-place in out color scheme to me.
This is how Discord implements reactions in dark mode (which I really like); maybe something similar would be worth a try? Screenshot-at-Nov-21-12-23-21.png
246326-01.jpeg
@Vishnu Ks @Cynthia Lin Is this alright?
This looks much better I think :)
Should I send a pull request now?
hmm. Lets wait for the feedback from some others as well.
@Tim Abbott @Cynthia Lin Please review and tell.
@Vishnu Ks Any update?
Feel free to create PR.
(Folks in the USA like myself were likely all inactive the last few days due to the Thanksgiving holiday)
@Vishnu Ks Please review https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/10897

@Prateek Jain To be honest, I don't like the dark-pink pastel color that is introduced.
Also it isn't immediately obvious to me which one of the two is the 'I have reacted' one.
The non-reacted should just be less distinctive, so from rgba(0,0,0,.2) it can be rgba(0,0,0,.1)
And the 'I have reacted' one can have a denser look than now rgba(0,0,0,.5) => rgba(0,0,0,.7)

@Boris Yankov No problem, thanks for a honest review. I will make the changes accordingly.
@Vishnu Ks Can you please also see it and tell me if I should go for it?

Selection_002.png

@Boris Yankov Does this look fine to you?
@Prateek Jain yeah, that looks more in the spirit of the light theme I think. Also we might make the border lighter a bit (lower the alpha)

[Uploading Selection_003.png…]()
@Boris Yankov Does this look fine?

Selection_004.png

@Tim Abbott @Boris Yankov @Vishnu Ks Please review it, I have made all the changes now accordingly.
Changed the color of count as it was, made border a bit lighter.
I dont understand how this is any different from the version we have currently.
I am honestly confused looking at the screenshots which one is reacted and which one is not.

On the other hand this one is so easy to figure out
Screenshot-at-Nov-21-12-23-21.png
Also, I don't think we want the purple tinge Discord uses, since purple hasn't been a prominent part of our color scheme; would prefer the green tinge all over zulipchat.com's portico pages.

I still think the issue of light mode reactions being indistinguishable is persistent; again, this is probably an influence from me being a longtime dark mode user (and that's why I wasn't particularly bothered by the dark mode reaction difference in the first place)

@Vishnu Ks So I should bring that blue tinge back as it was?
@Cynthia Lin Having tried that color scheme, I don't think it looks much odd. Infact, I think it blends right in.
Let me know whatever you all think is best and I will change it accordingly.
@Vishnu Ks Any update on this?
I am not sure about this yet. Tim or someone else might have better context.
Probably the right thing to do is deploy a version in chat.zulip.org and see how it goes.
@Tim Abbott Can you please give your views on this.
@Vishnu Ks So for now I have deleted my older PR, let me know what to do next.

I'm happy to mostly defer to @Cynthia Lin, who's done a lot of work on dark mode, for this. I think using a blue-direction color like we use in Zulip's light mode is the right choice if we're adding color as opposed to just greyscale changes. Since we have gotten feedback from some users that it's hard to tell, we should probably increase the difference between the two.

https://chat.zulip.org/user_uploads/2/43/9Ou_HTKt75zMusWhCBOT7Vol/246326-01.jpeg

@Tim Abbott So should I make a pull request with the above changes?
Slack has different text color for the two types of reaction

We should do what the light theme does:

  • I did not react - some border, transparent background
  • I did react - some border, differing background
In both light and dark theme we would benefit from gray/black text on 'I did not react' and same bluish color on 'I did react'

@Tim Abbott @Steve Howell could you suggest me what color should I put behind the reacted emojis, I read the whole above discussion but ended up confused? please help me up with issue #10840 ! just needs finalization.
Figuring out what color is right is the hard part of this issue :slight_smile:
I had put a color: blue; but it seems to attract too much attention in the night mode , like whatever you do you end up looking at it :sweat_smile:
Capture.PNG
what about this, it is a shade of blue color from our already being used color code in night mode and doesn't grabs that much attention too, but is easily distinguishable...
P.S.:sweat_smile: my color sense can be bad
The blue color in night mode I believe you have (from the box highlight/links, right?) is same in light mode; it was never adjusted specifically for night mode.

I think we'd want a green shade to match the color design on the portico pages (possible a shade like the Send button in the compose box?), but the final color should be definitely discussed more by the community before we reach a decision
I used the green color from there too, the only problem was it was making the 2, 3 i.e. the number written at the bottom very difficult to see because of it's light shade.
@Cynthia Lin yp, seems like you have got a lot of experience there :smile: ,That's the exact place where I took it from.:big_smile:
Did you consider using a darker text color to contrast the light background?
no, I thought that that would go out of scope for the issue, first issue i didn't wanted to experiment much :sweat_smile: , but I can try that out
z_col.PNG
what do you say about it?
@Cynthia Lin could you help finalise it? : )
bl.png g.PNG gw.png lb.png
@Vishnu Ks please have a look and tell me with which one should i proceed ?

Among the 4 I like the last one the best
https://chat.zulip.org/thumbor/BS_bq17rSRaFALgThywx9cAbagw=/smart/filters:no_upscale():sharpen(0.5,0.2,true)/L3VzZXJfdXBsb2Fkcy8yLzRlL093dFZFYVNjaDd1NlhXQVRxb3RVbVlhay9sYi5wbmc=/source_type/local_file
yeah it suits night mode unlike others, they attract too much attention. :sweat_smile: , should I tag other memebrs for review or get going with it?
Feel free to create a PR if you are not recieving further feedback :)
ohk :slight_smile: :+1:
Yeah, the last one lgtm.
I think we have deployed this feature on czo. The colour looks very out of place for my reactions in dark mode. I'd like to know how others feel about it or I'm the only one.
Yeah, I think the color isn't quite right yet. @Cynthia Lin what do you think?
Yeah, it's definitely jarring and not the right color.
I think the right colour would be the one on the border of a focused message. That seems like the blue which would suit the dark theme
Just decreasing the opacity a little and it could work nicely

Screenshot-2019-01-09-at-2.11.00-PM.png

@Cynthia Lin ^?
Screenshot-2019-01-09-at-2.15.08-PM.png
^In this above screenshot, I feel the second and third one don't convey the information we want it to. And I guess the first one is the current one? That already feels jarring.
@Abhigyan Khaund the first one is not the current one, the color's a bit different. Second one is normal state and third one is the "hover" state.

After using dark mode with this message reaction color scheme above for a month, I haven't gotten used to the jarring shade of blue we use for reactions you've reacted to yet. Because of my experience and the fact that there's no other place where that particular shade of blue is used, I'd propose to switch to the following:

  • reactions that you haven't reacted to yet: Transparent background, black outline
  • reaction on hover: Remove the white outline, or change the white outline to match our text color (which isn't pure white). Although I believe it's important to differentiate between hover and not hover, we don't have white outlines when we hover on things like buttons, which I believe reactions should be most similarly styled to resemble. Discord skips the reaction color change as well; the only thing that happens when you hover over a reaction is show who's added a reaction with the emoji you've just hovered over, which we do already.
  • reactions that you've reacted to: Dark black background, black outline, which is the current styling of reactions you haven't added reactions to. I would be open to switching to a shade of blue that fits with the rest of the dark mode color scheme (as in, not unique to message reactions and has been used somewhere else in the codebase).
This is a mockup of what I'm proposing: https://i.gyazo.com/b31c1444791fcad9d5beb295bdfde205.gif
I haven't used dark mode much, but seems like a good change to me!

@Cynthia Lin I also don't think the bluish tint was ideal. I think your change is perfect. The only other improvement I would make is to tone-down the 'I did not react' reaction border to be more transparent than what it is in the GIF.
@Boris Yankov Do you mean the black outline, or the white outline on hover?
The black (or darkish) outline on normal non-hovered state.
Does this look better? @Boris Yankov Screenshot-at-Feb-18-13-51-06.png
For me, it doesn't look like there's enough of a contrast between the outline and the background. Screenshot-at-Feb-18-14-02-51.png
I went ahead and opened #11611 and am open to more feedback; hopefully this gets merged for 2.0 since I think it's a small but major UI improvement
Thanks for working on this @Cynthia Lin! Posted a quick comment on the emoji picker part of the PR.
@Tim Abbott responded on the PR
@Cynthia Lin yeah, certainly better. I would set the border-color from gba(0,0,0,.5); to gba(0,0,0,.25); for the 'I did not react' one

We're using HSL in the codebase, and I changed it to hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.8); on the PR instead of the previous hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.9);. Here's the updated GIF (if you haven't seen it already) https://i.gyazo.com/fb3e426a0f2e412c8e0af5eb8930fa23.gif
EDIT: More changes with improvements to the emoji picker as discussed on the PR https://i.gyazo.com/8166b3e6f9b736cebc6a9c2b1afd318c.gif
